view.model

Class GameEngineGUISupport

  • java.lang.Object
    • view.model.GameEngineGUISupport
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameEngine, GameEngineSupport

    public class GameEngineGUISupport
extends java.lang.Object
implements GameEngineSupport
    Auxiliary GameEngine to aid the previous GameEngine in several additional operations. Plays the role of the ViewModel. Holds additional player related information. Uses the GameEngine passed during constructor for most of the operations. Aids in additional callbacks using the GameEngineCallbackSupport.

      • dealPlayer

        public void dealPlayer(Player player,
                       int delay)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: GameEngine
         Deal cards to the player as follows.
 1. Deal a card to the player.
 2. Call GameEngineCallback.nextCard(Player, PlayingCard , GameEngine).
 3. Continue looping until the player busts (default value of GameEngine.BUST_LEVEL).
 4. Call GameEngineCallback.bustCard(Player, PlayingCard, GameEngine).
 5. Call GameEngineCallback.result(Player, int, GameEngine)
    with final result for player (the pre bust total).
 6. Update the player with final result so it can be retrieved later.
        Specified by:
        dealPlayer in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:
        player - the current player who will have their result set at the end of the hand
        delay - the delay between cards being dealt (in milliseconds (ms))
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown when delay param is < 0 or > 1000

      • dealHouse

        public void dealHouse(int delay)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: GameEngine
         Same as GameEngine.dealPlayer(Player, int) other than the two notes below but deals for the house and calls the
 house versions of the callback methods on GameEngineCallback, no player parameter is required.
 
 Note:
 1. At the end of the round but before calling calling GameEngineCallback.houseResult(int, GameEngine)
 this method should iterate all players and call GameEngine.applyWinLoss(Player, int) 
 to update each player's points.
 2. After calling GameEngineCallback.houseResult(int, GameEngine)
 this method should also call Player.resetBet() on each player in preparation for 
 the next round.
        Specified by:
        dealHouse in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:
        delay - the delay between cards being dealt (in milliseconds (ms))
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown when delay param is < 0

      • applyWinLoss

        public void applyWinLoss(Player player,
                         int houseResult)
        Description copied from interface: GameEngine
         A player's bet is settled by this method i.e. win or loss is applied to update betting points
 based on a comparison of the player result and the provided houseResult.
 Note:
 This method is usually called from GameEngine.dealHouse(int)
 as described above but is included in the public interface to facilitate testing.
        Specified by:
        applyWinLoss in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:
        player - the Player to apply win/loss to
        houseResult - contains the calculated house result

      • addGameEngineCallback

        public void addGameEngineCallback(GameEngineCallback gameEngineCallback)
        Description copied from interface: GameEngine
         Method to add a client specific implementation of GameEngineCallback used to perform display updates etc.
 Callbacks are called in the order they were added.
 Note: Used different implementation of the callback for the console and GUI versions.
        Specified by:
        addGameEngineCallback in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:
        gameEngineCallback - the callback object

      • getShuffledHalfDeck
